cassidy hutchinson testified about were
stories that she did not witness herself
she was just told about them like the
alleged altercation
in the president's limo the question of
course is how close is someone in her
position to these people
does that help her credibility and i
know that there's been reporting
including from scott that the secret
service uh says that they are have been

i know there's also been some reports

service are prepared to reject the

thing for a source to say something to a

in fear of perjury sworn testimony to

yeah let's
let's see with the secret service
if they testify under oath let's see
what they say under oath
where you are bound by law to tell the
truth
in terms of
cassidy hutchinson
you know you watch the testimony she
seems like a credible
witness to
to what happened inside the white house
now

well sure it could and you'd have to get

to testify to seeing similar things to
get something like that those kinds of
allegations to to really hold up in a

however in the court of public
opinion
she was
pretty effective that was some pretty
stunning testimony
uh
she talked about the fact and this this
really stood out to me as someone who
was on capitol hill that day
but not only on capitol hill i was at
the ellipse where the president and rudy
giuliani john eastman and others mo
brooks
made those speeches
so
the fact that she was talking about what
was happening in the white house before
the attack on the capitol hours before
the attack on the capital
and the fact that she testified that
there were several people in the white
house who
were aware of the potential for violence
that day
that to me was stunning because what it
says
according to her testimony what it says
is that people in the white house
including the president himself
were aware of the potential for violence
they were aware that there were people
in the crowd who had
ar-15s who had pistols they were aware
of the intelligence reports coming from
law enforcement on the ground seeing
armed people in trees
they were aware in the white house hours
before the attack
of what could happen
and instead of beefing up security and
again i was there that day and i was not
aware
of the amount of
firearms in that crowd we were talking
to some of the militia
members we were talking to people in the
crowd we knew they didn't like media
and at one point our our equipment our
truck our vehicle was attacked with some
guy with i think it was a flagpole
but that was the extent of it i did see
people
carrying weapons but not ar-15s
and then to see the tone change in that
crowd after the president's speech
after rudy giuliani's speech who said
notably
trial by combat
and then to hear cassidy hutchinson say
that people inside the white house were
trying to tone down the remarks
they were trying to tone down the
remarks because according to her
testimony
the suggestion was that they knew that
some of those remarks could incite
people
and based on what i saw
the tone changed there after the speech
from the president after the speech from
rudy giuliani
it changed and people started rushing up
toward the capitol i had no idea that
people would start climbing the walls
and assaulting police officers but very
clearly they got marching orders from
someone and whether the department of
justice
proves that it was from the president or
it was from rudy giuliani or some of the
other characters there we'll see but
that testimony yesterday
it was eye-opening it was incredibly
revealing yeah jeff i was with you on
that because i was sort of under the

find out no people actually had firearms
there and that the president wanted to

according to our testimony to get rid of

they're not coming after me which sort
of blows a hole in the argument that oh
these were antifa or you know some other
group was a
violent seeking rabble rousers i guess
the president thought differently that's
right but then jeff when we think this
whole thing is over and we've listened
to the stunning testimony everything's

says something that stunned me she shows
transcripts of calls where people in

like she was setting up a case for

how serious is this
a witness tampering certainly in a court

and it is equally disturbing when you're

a hearing in

going to be
under oath providing testimony
but frankly i was not surprised
in fact
as i was watching that hearing in real

congresswoman cheney
and heard her read those
messages to people i thought about what
former fbi director james comey who
you know in some circles has been

in other circles he remains someone who

but he said years ago

he said that it felt like he was

that's what he said
and those kinds of
statements
witness intimidation allegedly
potentially
yeah i mean it reminds you of the way

you know who says that kind of thing and

think this is important too
just adding to what you said about the

you know i think sometimes
what gets lost sadly
is that as a result of january 6

five police officers died
they were overwhelmed that day
people were pounding on them
they felt some of the people caught in

felt like their lives were in danger
that people were gonna grab their
weapons and turn them on the officers
this was a serious attack and i get
upset every time i hear people sort of
dismiss it is nothing i saw it i

when i was witnessing it and then to

given the potential for violence and the
